page.title: 02GEOLOGY DOWNDERRY
page.content: THE GEOLOGY OF THIS AREA IS SIMPLE.A LANDWARD PLATEAU 50 FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL COMPOSED OF GLACIAL HEAD, OVERLYING THE BEDROCK OF DARTMOUTH SHALES LOCALLY KNOWN AS SHILLET.BOTH THE HEAD AND THE BEDROCK ARE SUBJECT TO EXTENSIVE EROSION,PRIMARILY AS CONTINUAL ACTION BY THE SEA AT THE CLIFF BASE PREVENTS THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NATURAL ANGLE OF REPOSE FOR THE SOIL MANY SIMPLE BUT EFFECTIVE LOW WALLS HAVE BEEN CONSTRUCTED BY LANDOWNERS. THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES FAVOUR MAJOR CONCRETE SEA WALLS OR LARGE GABION WALLS SUCH AS PRESENTLY BUILT BEHIND THE MAIN BEACH.PLANS ARE IN HAND TO PRODUCE A WALL (IN 5 PHASES) FROM SEATON TO DOWNDERRY BUT THE COST IS CAUSING A DELAY WHICH COULD MEAN THAT THIS D BLOCK WILL HAVE DISAPPEARED BEFORE THE WALL IS IN PLACE.PHASE 1 IS BUILT,PHASE 2 IS AT PLAN STAGE !
